005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.util.WPIUtilJNI;
008import edu.wpi.first.util.concurrent.Event;
009import edu.wpi.first.util.datalog.DataLog;
010import java.util.HashMap;
011import java.util.Map;
012import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
013import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
014import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
015import java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition;
016import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
017import java.util.function.Consumer;
018
019/**
020 * NetworkTables Instance.
021 *
022 * <p>Instances are completely independent from each other. Table operations on one instance will
023 * not be visible to other instances unless the instances are connected via the network. The main
024 * limitation on instances is that you cannot have two servers on the same network port. The main
025 * utility of instances is for unit testing, but they can also enable one program to connect to two
026 * different NetworkTables networks.
027 *
028 * <p>The global "default" instance (as returned by {@link #getDefault()}) is always available, and
029 * is intended for the common case when there is only a single NetworkTables instance being used in
030 * the program.
031 *
032 * <p>Additional instances can be created with the {@link #create()} function. A reference must be
033 * kept to the NetworkTableInstance returned by this function to keep it from being garbage
034 * collected.
035 */
036@SuppressWarnings("PMD.CouplingBetweenObjects")
037public final class NetworkTableInstance implements AutoCloseable {
038  /**
039   * Client/server mode flag values (as returned by {@link #getNetworkMode()}). This is a bitmask.
040   */
041  public static final int kNetModeNone = 0x00;
042
043  public static final int kNetModeServer = 0x01;
044  public static final int kNetModeClient3 = 0x02;
045  public static final int kNetModeClient4 = 0x04;
046  public static final int kNetModeStarting = 0x08;
047  public static final int kNetModeLocal = 0x10;
048
049  /** The default port that network tables operates on for NT3. */
050  public static final int kDefaultPort3 = 1735;
051
052  /** The default port that network tables operates on for NT4. */
053  public static final int kDefaultPort4 = 5810;
054
055  /**
056   * Construct from native handle.
057   *
058   * @param handle Native handle
059   */
060  private NetworkTableInstance(int handle) {
061    m_owned = false;
062    m_handle = handle;
063  }
064
065  /** Destroys the instance (if created by {@link #create()}). */
066  @Override
067  public synchronized void close() {
068    if (m_owned && m_handle != 0) {
069      m_connectionListener.close();
070      m_topicListener.close();
071      m_valueListener.close();
072      NetworkTablesJNI.destroyInstance(m_handle);
073    }
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * Determines if the native handle is valid.
078   *
079   * @return True if the native handle is valid, false otherwise.
080   */
081  public boolean isValid() {
082    return m_handle != 0;
083  }
084
085  /* The default instance. */
086  private static NetworkTableInstance s_defaultInstance;
087
088  /**
089   * Get global default instance.
090   *
091   * @return Global default instance
092   */
093  public static synchronized NetworkTableInstance getDefault() {
094    if (s_defaultInstance == null) {
095      s_defaultInstance = new NetworkTableInstance(NetworkTablesJNI.getDefaultInstance());
096    }
097    return s_defaultInstance;
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Create an instance. Note: A reference to the returned instance must be retained to ensure the
102   * instance is not garbage collected.
103   *
104   * @return Newly created instance
105   */
106  public static NetworkTableInstance create() {
107    NetworkTableInstance inst = new NetworkTableInstance(NetworkTablesJNI.createInstance());
108    inst.m_owned = true;
109    return inst;
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Gets the native handle for the instance.
114   *
115   * @return Native handle
116   */
117  public int getHandle() {
118    return m_handle;
119  }
120
121  /**
122   * Get (generic) topic.
123   *
124   * @param name topic name
125   * @return Topic
126   */
127  public Topic getTopic(String name) {
128    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
129    if (topic == null) {
130      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
131      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
132      Topic oldTopic = m_topics.putIfAbsent(name, topic);
133      if (oldTopic != null) {
134        topic = oldTopic;
135      }
136      // also cache by handle
137      m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
138    }
139    return topic;
140  }
141
142  /**
143   * Get boolean topic.
144   *
145   * @param name topic name
146   * @return BooleanTopic
147   */
148  public BooleanTopic getBooleanTopic(String name) {
149    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
150    if (topic instanceof BooleanTopic) {
151      return (BooleanTopic) topic;
152    }
153
154    int handle;
155    if (topic == null) {
156      handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
157    } else {
158      handle = topic.getHandle();
159    }
160
161    topic = new BooleanTopic(this, handle);
162    m_topics.put(name, topic);
163
164    // also cache by handle
165    m_topicsByHandle.put(handle, topic);
166
167    return (BooleanTopic) topic;
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Get long topic.
172   *
173   * @param name topic name
174   * @return IntegerTopic
175   */
176  public IntegerTopic getIntegerTopic(String name) {
177    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
178    if (topic instanceof IntegerTopic) {
179      return (IntegerTopic) topic;
180    }
181
182    int handle;
183    if (topic == null) {
184      handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
185    } else {
186      handle = topic.getHandle();
187    }
188
189    topic = new IntegerTopic(this, handle);
190    m_topics.put(name, topic);
191
192    // also cache by handle
193    m_topicsByHandle.put(handle, topic);
194
195    return (IntegerTopic) topic;
196  }

449
450  private Topic[] topicHandlesToTopics(int[] handles) {
451    Topic[] topics = new Topic[handles.length];
452    for (int i = 0; i < handles.length; i++) {
453      topics[i] = getCachedTopic(handles[i]);
454    }
455    return topics;
456  }
457
458  /**
459   * Get all published topics.
460   *
461   * @return Array of topics.
462   */
463  public Topic[] getTopics() {
464    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, "", 0));
465  }
466
467  /**
468   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
469   * string prefix to only return a subset of all topics.
470   *
471   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
472   *     returned
473   * @return Array of topic information.
474   */
475  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix) {
476    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, prefix, 0));
477  }
478
479  /**
480   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
481   * string prefix and data type to only return a subset of all topics.
482   *
483   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
484   *     returned
485   * @param types bitmask of data types; 0 is treated as a "don't care"
486   * @return Array of topic information.
487   */
488  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix, int types) {
489    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, prefix, types));
490  }
491
492  /**
493   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
494   * string prefix and data type to only return a subset of all topics.
495   *
496   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
497   *     returned
498   * @param types array of data type strings
499   * @return Array of topic information.
500   */
501  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix, String[] types) {
502    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopicsStr(m_handle, prefix, types));
503  }
504

551
552  /* Cache of created entries. */
553  private final ConcurrentMap<String, NetworkTableEntry> m_entries = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
554
555  /**
556   * Gets the entry for a key.
557   *
558   * @param name Key
559   * @return Network table entry.
560   */
561  public NetworkTableEntry getEntry(String name) {
562    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_entries.get(name);
563    if (entry == null) {
564      entry = new NetworkTableEntry(this, NetworkTablesJNI.getEntry(m_handle, name));
565      NetworkTableEntry oldEntry = m_entries.putIfAbsent(name, entry);
566      if (oldEntry != null) {
567        entry = oldEntry;
568      }
569    }
570    return entry;
571  }
572
573  /* Cache of created topics. */
574  private final ConcurrentMap<String, Topic> m_topics = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
575  private final ConcurrentMap<Integer, Topic> m_topicsByHandle = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
576
577  Topic getCachedTopic(String name) {
578    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
579    if (topic == null) {
580      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
581      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
582      Topic oldTopic = m_topics.putIfAbsent(name, topic);
583      if (oldTopic != null) {
584        topic = oldTopic;
585      }
586      // also cache by handle
587      m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
588    }
589    return topic;
590  }
591
592  Topic getCachedTopic(int handle) {
593    Topic topic = m_topicsByHandle.get(handle);
594    if (topic == null) {
595      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
596      Topic oldTopic = m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
597      if (oldTopic != null) {
598        topic = oldTopic;
599      }
600    }
601    return topic;
602  }
603
604  /* Cache of created tables. */
605  private final ConcurrentMap<String, NetworkTable> m_tables = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
606
607  /**
608   * Gets the table with the specified key.
609   *
610   * @param key the key name
611   * @return The network table
612   */
613  public NetworkTable getTable(String key) {
614    // prepend leading / if not present
615    String theKey;
616    if (key.isEmpty() || "/".equals(key)) {
617      theKey = "";
618    } else if (key.charAt(0) == NetworkTable.PATH_SEPARATOR) {
619      theKey = key;
620    } else {
621      theKey = NetworkTable.PATH_SEPARATOR + key;
622    }
623
624    // cache created tables
625    NetworkTable table = m_tables.get(theKey);
626    if (table == null) {
627      table = new NetworkTable(this, theKey);
628      NetworkTable oldTable = m_tables.putIfAbsent(theKey, table);
629      if (oldTable != null) {
630        table = oldTable;
631      }
632    }
633    return table;
634  }
635
636  /*
637   * Callback Creation Functions
638   */
639
640  private abstract static class ListenerBase<T extends NotificationBase> implements AutoCloseable {
641    protected final ReentrantLock m_lock = new ReentrantLock();
642    protected final Map<Integer, Consumer<T>> m_listeners = new HashMap<>();
643    private Thread m_thread;
644    protected int m_poller;
645    private boolean m_waitQueue;
646    private final Event m_waitQueueEvent = new Event();
647    private final Condition m_waitQueueCond = m_lock.newCondition();
648    protected final NetworkTableInstance m_inst;
649
650    ListenerBase(NetworkTableInstance inst) {
651      m_inst = inst;
652    }
653
654    @Override
655    public void close() {
656      if (m_poller != 0) {
657        destroyPoller();
658      }
659      m_poller = 0;
660    }
661
662    protected abstract T[] readQueue();
663
664    protected abstract void destroyPoller();
665
666    protected void startThread(String name) {
667      m_thread =
668          new Thread(
669              () -> {
670                boolean wasInterrupted = false;
671                int[] handles = new int[] { m_poller, m_waitQueueEvent.getHandle() };
672                while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
673                  try {
674                    WPIUtilJNI.waitForObjects(handles);
675                  } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
676                    m_lock.lock();
677                    try {
678                      if (m_waitQueue) {
679                        m_waitQueue = false;
680                        m_waitQueueCond.signalAll();
681                      }
682                    } finally {
683                      m_lock.unlock();
684                    }
685                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
686                    // don't try to destroy poller, as its handle is likely no longer valid
687                    wasInterrupted = true;
688                    break;
689                  }
690                  for (T event : readQueue()) {
691                    Consumer<T> listener;
692                    m_lock.lock();
693                    try {
694                      listener = m_listeners.get(event.listener);
695                    } finally {
696                      m_lock.unlock();
697                    }
698                    if (listener != null) {
699                      try {
700                        listener.accept(event);
701                      } catch (Throwable throwable) {
702                        System.err.println(
703                            "Unhandled exception during listener callback: "
704                            + throwable.toString());
705                        throwable.printStackTrace();
706                      }
707                    }
708                  }
709                  m_lock.lock();
710                  try {
711                    if (m_waitQueue) {
712                      m_waitQueue = false;
713                      m_waitQueueCond.signalAll();
714                    }
715                  } finally {
716                    m_lock.unlock();
717                  }
718                }
719                m_lock.lock();
720                try {
721                  if (!wasInterrupted) {
722                    destroyPoller();
723                  }
724                  m_poller = 0;
725                } finally {
726                  m_lock.unlock();
727                }
728              },
729              name);
730      m_thread.setDaemon(true);
731      m_thread.start();
732    }
733
734    boolean waitForQueue(double timeout) {
735      m_lock.lock();
736      try {
737        if (m_poller != 0) {
738          m_waitQueue = true;
739          m_waitQueueEvent.set();
740          while (m_waitQueue) {
741            try {
742              if (timeout < 0) {
743                m_waitQueueCond.await();
744              } else {
745                return m_waitQueueCond.await((long) (timeout * 1e9), TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS);
746              }
747            } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
748              Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
749              return true;
750            }
751          }
752        }
753      } finally {
754        m_lock.unlock();
755      }
756      return true;
757    }
758  }
759
760  private static final class ConnectionListener extends ListenerBase<ConnectionNotification> {
761    ConnectionListener(NetworkTableInstance inst) {
762      super(inst);
763    }
764
765    int add(boolean immediateNotify, Consumer<ConnectionNotification> listener) {
766      m_lock.lock();
767      try {
768        if (m_poller == 0) {
769          m_poller = NetworkTablesJNI.createConnectionListenerPoller(m_inst.getHandle());
770          startThread("NTConnectionListener");
771        }
772        int h = NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledConnectionListener(m_poller, immediateNotify);
773        m_listeners.put(h, listener);
774        return h;
775      } finally {
776        m_lock.unlock();
777      }
778    }
779
780    void remove(int listener) {
781      m_lock.lock();
782      try {
783        m_listeners.remove(listener);
784      } finally {
785        m_lock.unlock();
786      }
787      NetworkTablesJNI.removeConnectionListener(listener);
788    }
789
790    @Override
791    protected ConnectionNotification[] readQueue() {
792      return NetworkTablesJNI.readConnectionListenerQueue(m_inst, m_poller);
793    }
794
795    @Override
796    protected void destroyPoller() {
797      NetworkTablesJNI.destroyConnectionListenerPoller(m_poller);
798    }
799  }
800
801  private ConnectionListener m_connectionListener = new ConnectionListener(this);
802
803  /**
804   * Add a connection listener. The callback function is called asynchronously on a separate
805   * thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when accessing any shared state
806   * from the callback function.
807   *
808   * @param immediateNotify Notify listener of all existing connections
809   * @param listener Listener to add
810   * @return Listener handle
811   */
812  public int addConnectionListener(
813      boolean immediateNotify, Consumer<ConnectionNotification> listener) {
814    return m_connectionListener.add(immediateNotify, listener);
815  }
816
817  /**
818   * Remove a connection listener.
819   *
820   * @param listener Listener handle to remove
821   */
822  public void removeConnectionListener(int listener) {
823    m_connectionListener.remove(listener);
824  }
825
826  /**
827   * Wait for the connection listener queue to be empty. This is primarily useful for deterministic
828   * testing. This blocks until either the connection listener queue is empty (e.g. there are no
829   * more events that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
830   *
831   * @param timeout timeout, in seconds. Set to 0 for non-blocking behavior, or a negative value to
832   *     block indefinitely
833   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.
834   */
835  public boolean waitForConnectionListenerQueue(double timeout) {
836    return m_connectionListener.waitForQueue(timeout);
837  }
838
839  private static final class TopicListener extends ListenerBase<TopicNotification> {
840    TopicListener(NetworkTableInstance inst) {
841      super(inst);
842    }
843
844    int add(int handle, int eventMask, Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
845      m_lock.lock();
846      try {
847        if (m_poller == 0) {
848          m_poller = NetworkTablesJNI.createTopicListenerPoller(m_inst.getHandle());
849          startThread("NTTopicListener");
850        }
851        int h = NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledTopicListener(m_poller, handle, eventMask);
852        m_listeners.put(h, listener);
853        return h;
854      } finally {
855        m_lock.unlock();
856      }
857    }
858
859    int add(String[] prefixes, int eventMask, Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
860      m_lock.lock();
861      try {
862        if (m_poller == 0) {
863          m_poller = NetworkTablesJNI.createTopicListenerPoller(m_inst.getHandle());
864          startThread("NTTopicListener");
865        }
866        int h = NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledTopicListener(m_poller, prefixes, eventMask);
867        m_listeners.put(h, listener);
868        return h;
869      } finally {
870        m_lock.unlock();
871      }
872    }
873
874    void remove(int listener) {
875      m_lock.lock();
876      try {
877        m_listeners.remove(listener);
878      } finally {
879        m_lock.unlock();
880      }
881      NetworkTablesJNI.removeTopicListener(listener);
882    }
883
884    @Override
885    protected TopicNotification[] readQueue() {
886      return NetworkTablesJNI.readTopicListenerQueue(m_inst, m_poller);
887    }
888
889    @Override
890    protected void destroyPoller() {
891      NetworkTablesJNI.destroyTopicListenerPoller(m_poller);
892    }
893  }
894
895  private TopicListener m_topicListener = new TopicListener(this);
896
897  /**
898   * Add a topic listener for changes on a particular topic. The callback function is called
899   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
900   * accessing any shared state from the callback function.
901   *
902   * @param topic Topic
903   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
904   * @param listener Listener function
905   * @return Listener handle
906   */
907  public int addTopicListener(
908      Topic topic, int eventMask, Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
909    if (topic.getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
910      throw new IllegalArgumentException("topic is not from this instance");
911    }
912    return m_topicListener.add(topic.getHandle(), eventMask, listener);
913  }
914
915  /**
916   * Add a topic listener for topic changes on a subscriber. The callback function is called
917   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
918   * accessing any shared state from the callback function. This does NOT keep the subscriber
919   * active.
920   *
921   * @param subscriber Subscriber
922   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
923   * @param listener Listener function
924   * @return Listener handle
925   */
926  public int addTopicListener(
927      Subscriber subscriber, int eventMask, Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
928    if (subscriber.getTopic().getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
929      throw new IllegalArgumentException("subscriber is not from this instance");
930    }
931    return m_topicListener.add(subscriber.getHandle(), eventMask, listener);
932  }
933
934  /**
935   * Add a topic listener for topic changes on a subscriber. The callback function is called
936   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
937   * accessing any shared state from the callback function. This does NOT keep the subscriber
938   * active.
939   *
940   * @param subscriber Subscriber
941   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
942   * @param listener Listener function
943   * @return Listener handle
944   */
945  public int addTopicListener(
946      MultiSubscriber subscriber, int eventMask, Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
947    if (subscriber.getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
948      throw new IllegalArgumentException("subscriber is not from this instance");
949    }
950    return m_topicListener.add(subscriber.getHandle(), eventMask, listener);
951  }
952
953  /**
954   * Add a topic listener for topic changes on an entry. The callback function is called
955   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
956   * accessing any shared state from the callback function.
957   *
958   * @param entry Entry
959   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
960   * @param listener Listener function
961   * @return Listener handle
962   */
963  public int addTopicListener(
964      NetworkTableEntry entry, int eventMask, Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
965    if (entry.getTopic().getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
966      throw new IllegalArgumentException("entry is not from this instance");
967    }
968    return m_topicListener.add(entry.getHandle(), eventMask, listener);
969  }
970
971  /**
972   * Add a topic listener for changes to topics with names that start with any of the given
973   * prefixes. The callback function is called asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's
974   * important to use synchronization or atomics when accessing any shared state from the callback
975   * function.
976   *
977   * @param prefixes Topic name string prefixes
978   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
979   * @param listener Listener function
980   * @return Listener handle
981   */
982  public int addTopicListener(
983      String[] prefixes,
984      int eventMask,
985      Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
986    return m_topicListener.add(prefixes, eventMask, listener);
987  }

1001   * more events that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
1002   *

1004   *     block indefinitely
1005   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.

1011  private static final class ValueListener extends ListenerBase<ValueNotification> {
1012    ValueListener(NetworkTableInstance inst) {
1013      super(inst);
1014    }
1015
1016    int add(int handle, int eventMask, Consumer<ValueNotification> listener) {
1017      m_lock.lock();
1018      try {
1019        if (m_poller == 0) {
1020          m_poller = NetworkTablesJNI.createValueListenerPoller(m_inst.getHandle());
1021          startThread("NTValueListener");
1022        }
1023        int h = NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledValueListener(m_poller, handle, eventMask);
1024        m_listeners.put(h, listener);
1025        return h;
1026      } finally {
1027        m_lock.unlock();
1028      }
1029    }
1030
1031    void remove(int listener) {
1032      m_lock.lock();
1033      try {
1034        m_listeners.remove(listener);
1035      } finally {
1036        m_lock.unlock();
1037      }
1038      NetworkTablesJNI.removeValueListener(listener);
1039    }
1040
1041    @Override
1042    protected ValueNotification[] readQueue() {
1043      return NetworkTablesJNI.readValueListenerQueue(m_inst, m_poller);
1044    }
1045
1046    @Override
1047    protected void destroyPoller() {
1048      NetworkTablesJNI.destroyValueListenerPoller(m_poller);
1049    }
1050  }

1058   * active.

1139   * @return Bitmask of NetworkMode.
1140   */

1143  }

1145  /**
1146   * Starts local-only operation. Prevents calls to startServer or startClient from taking effect.
1147   * Has no effect if startServer or startClient has already been called.
1148   */
1149  public void startLocal() {
1150    NetworkTablesJNI.startLocal(m_handle);
1151  }
1152
1153  /**
1154   * Stops local-only operation. startServer or startClient can be called after this call to start a
1155   * server or client.
1156   */
1157  public void stopLocal() {
1158    NetworkTablesJNI.stopLocal(m_handle);
1159  }
1160
1161  /**
1162   * Starts a server using the networktables.json as the persistent file, using the default
1163   * listening address and port.
1164   */
1165  public void startServer() {
1166    startServer("networktables.json");
1167  }
1168
1169  /**
1170   * Starts a server using the specified persistent filename, using the default listening address
1171   * and port.
1172   *
1173   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
1174   */
1175  public void startServer(String persistFilename) {
1176    startServer(persistFilename, "");
1177  }
1178
1179  /**
1180   * Starts a server using the specified filename and listening address, using the default port.
1181   *
1182   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
1183   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
1184   */
1185  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress) {
1186    startServer(persistFilename, listenAddress, kDefaultPort3, kDefaultPort4);
1187  }
1188
1189  /**
1190   * Starts a server using the specified filename, listening address, and port.
1191   *
1192   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
1193   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
1194   * @param port3 port to communicate over (NT3)
1195   */
1196  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress, int port3) {
1197    startServer(persistFilename, listenAddress, port3, kDefaultPort4);
1198  }
1199
1200  /**
1201   * Starts a server using the specified filename, listening address, and port.
1202   *
1203   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
1204   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
1205   * @param port3 port to communicate over (NT3)
1206   * @param port4 port to communicate over (NT4)
1207   */
1208  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress, int port3, int port4) {
1209    NetworkTablesJNI.startServer(m_handle, persistFilename, listenAddress, port3, port4);
1210  }

1212  /** Stops the server if it is running. */
1213  public void stopServer() {
1214    NetworkTablesJNI.stopServer(m_handle);
1215  }

1219   *
1220   * @param identity network identity to advertise (cannot be empty string)
1221   */
1222  public void startClient3(String identity) {
1223    NetworkTablesJNI.startClient3(m_handle, identity);
1224  }

1230   */
1231  public void startClient4(String identity) {
1232    NetworkTablesJNI.startClient4(m_handle, identity);

1235  /** Stops the client if it is running. */

1238  }
1239
1240  /**
1241   * Sets server address and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
1242   * default port.
1243   *
1244   * @param serverName server name
1245   */
1246  public void setServer(String serverName) {
1247    setServer(serverName, 0);
1248  }
1249
1250  /**
1251   * Sets server address and port for client (without restarting client).
1252   *
1253   * @param serverName server name
1254   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
1255   */
1256  public void setServer(String serverName, int port) {
1257    NetworkTablesJNI.setServer(m_handle, serverName, port);
1258  }
1259
1260  /**
1261   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
1262   * default port. The client will attempt to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1263   *
1264   * @param serverNames array of server names
1265   */
1266  public void setServer(String[] serverNames) {
1267    setServer(serverNames, 0);
1268  }
1269
1270  /**
1271   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). The client will attempt
1272   * to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1273   *
1274   * @param serverNames array of server names
1275   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
1276   */
1277  public void setServer(String[] serverNames, int port) {
1278    int[] ports = new int[serverNames.length];
1279    for (int i = 0; i < serverNames.length; i++) {
1280      ports[i] = port;
1281    }
1282    setServer(serverNames, ports);
1283  }
1284
1285  /**
1286   * Sets server addresses and ports for client (without restarting client). The client will attempt
1287   * to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1288   *
1289   * @param serverNames array of server names
1290   * @param ports array of port numbers (0=default)
1291   */
1292  public void setServer(String[] serverNames, int[] ports) {
1293    NetworkTablesJNI.setServer(m_handle, serverNames, ports);
1294  }
1295
1296  /**
1297   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
1298   * default port. The client will attempt to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1299   *
1300   * @param team team number
1301   */
1302  public void setServerTeam(int team) {
1303    setServerTeam(team, 0);
1304  }
1305
1306  /**
1307   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Connects using commonly
1308   * known robot addresses for the specified team.
1309   *
1310   * @param team team number
1311   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
1312   */
1313  public void setServerTeam(int team, int port) {
1314    NetworkTablesJNI.setServerTeam(m_handle, team, port);
1315  }

1317  /**

1319   * running on localhost to obtain the server IP address, and connects with the default port.
1320   */
1321  public void startDSClient() {
1322    startDSClient(0);
1323  }
1324

1327   * running on localhost to obtain the server IP address.

1330   */
1331  public void startDSClient(int port) {

1338  }

1340  /**
1341   * Flushes all updated values immediately to the local client/server. This does not flush to the
1342   * network.
1343   */
1344  public void flushLocal() {
1345    NetworkTablesJNI.flushLocal(m_handle);
1346  }
1347
1348  /**
1349   * Flushes all updated values immediately to the network. Note: This is rate-limited to protect
1350   * the network from flooding. This is primarily useful for synchronizing network updates with user
1351   * code.
1352   */
1353  public void flush() {
1354    NetworkTablesJNI.flush(m_handle);
1355  }
1356
1357  /**
1358   * Gets information on the currently established network connections. If operating as a client,
1359   * this will return either zero or one values.
1360   *
1361   * @return array of connection information
1362   */
1363  public ConnectionInfo[] getConnections() {
1364    return NetworkTablesJNI.getConnections(m_handle);
1365  }
1366
1367  /**
1368   * Return whether or not the instance is connected to another node.
1369   *
1370   * @return True if connected.
1371   */
1372  public boolean isConnected() {
1373    return NetworkTablesJNI.isConnected(m_handle);
1374  }

1376  /**
1377   * Starts logging entry changes to a DataLog.
1378   *
1379   * @param log data log object; lifetime must extend until StopEntryDataLog is called or the
1380   *     instance is destroyed
1381   * @param prefix only store entries with names that start with this prefix; the prefix is not
1382   *     included in the data log entry name
1383   * @param logPrefix prefix to add to data log entry names
1384   * @return Data logger handle
1385   */
1386  public int startEntryDataLog(DataLog log, String prefix, String logPrefix) {
1387    return NetworkTablesJNI.startEntryDataLog(m_handle, log, prefix, logPrefix);
1388  }
1389
1390  /**
1391   * Stops logging entry changes to a DataLog.
1392   *
1393   * @param logger data logger handle
1394   */
1395  public static void stopEntryDataLog(int logger) {
1396    NetworkTablesJNI.stopEntryDataLog(logger);
1397  }
1398
1399  /**
1400   * Starts logging connection changes to a DataLog.
1401   *
1402   * @param log data log object; lifetime must extend until StopConnectionDataLog is called or the
1403   *     instance is destroyed
1404   * @param name data log entry name
1405   * @return Data logger handle
1406   */
1407  public int startConnectionDataLog(DataLog log, String name) {
1408    return NetworkTablesJNI.startConnectionDataLog(m_handle, log, name);
1409  }
1410
1411  /**
1412   * Stops logging connection changes to a DataLog.
1413   *
1414   * @param logger data logger handle
1415   */
1416  public static void stopConnectionDataLog(int logger) {
1417    NetworkTablesJNI.stopConnectionDataLog(logger);
1418  }
1419
1420  private final ReentrantLock m_loggerLock = new ReentrantLock();
1421  private final Map<Integer, Consumer<LogMessage>> m_loggers = new HashMap<>();
1422  private int m_loggerPoller;
1423
1424  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidCatchingThrowable")
1425  private void startLogThread() {
1426    var loggerThread =
1427        new Thread(
1428            () -> {
1429              boolean wasInterrupted = false;
1430              while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
1431                try {
1432                  WPIUtilJNI.waitForObject(m_loggerPoller);
1433                } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1434                  Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1435                  // don't try to destroy poller, as its handle is likely no longer valid
1436                  wasInterrupted = true;
1437                  break;
1438                }
1439                LogMessage[] events = NetworkTablesJNI.readLoggerQueue(this, m_loggerPoller);
1440                for (LogMessage event : events) {
1441                  Consumer<LogMessage> logger;
1442                  m_loggerLock.lock();
1443                  try {
1444                    logger = m_loggers.get(event.logger);
1445                  } finally {
1446                    m_loggerLock.unlock();
1447                  }
1448                  if (logger != null) {
1449                    try {
1450                      logger.accept(event);
1451                    } catch (Throwable throwable) {
1452                      System.err.println(
1453                          "Unhandled exception during logger callback: " + throwable.toString());
1454                      throwable.printStackTrace();
1455                    }
1456                  }
1457                }
1458              }
1459              m_loggerLock.lock();
1460              try {
1461                if (!wasInterrupted) {
1462                  NetworkTablesJNI.destroyLoggerPoller(m_loggerPoller);
1463                }
1464              } finally {
1465                m_loggerLock.unlock();
1466              }
1467            },
1468            "NTLogger");
1469    loggerThread.setDaemon(true);
1470    loggerThread.start();
1471  }
1472
1473  /**
1474   * Add logger callback function. By default, log messages are sent to stderr; this function sends
1475   * log messages with the specified levels to the provided callback function instead. The callback
1476   * function will only be called for log messages with level greater than or equal to minLevel and
1477   * less than or equal to maxLevel; messages outside this range will be silently ignored.
1478   *
1479   * @param func log callback function
1480   * @param minLevel minimum log level
1481   * @param maxLevel maximum log level
1482   * @return Logger handle
1483   */
1484  public int addLogger(Consumer<LogMessage> func, int minLevel, int maxLevel) {
1485    m_loggerLock.lock();
1486    try {
1487      if (m_loggerPoller == 0) {
1488        m_loggerPoller = NetworkTablesJNI.createLoggerPoller(m_handle);
1489        startLogThread();
1490      }
1491      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledLogger(m_loggerPoller, minLevel, maxLevel);
1492      m_loggers.put(handle, func);
1493      return handle;
1494    } finally {
1495      m_loggerLock.unlock();
1496    }
1497  }
1498
1499  /**
1500   * Remove a logger.
1501   *
1502   * @param logger Logger handle to remove
1503   */
1504  public void removeLogger(int logger) {
1505    m_loggerLock.lock();
1506    try {
1507      m_loggers.remove(logger);
1508    } finally {
1509      m_loggerLock.unlock();
1510    }
1511    NetworkTablesJNI.removeLogger(logger);
1512  }
1513
1514  @Override
1515  public boolean equals(Object other) {
1516    if (other == this) {
1517      return true;
1518    }
1519    if (!(other instanceof NetworkTableInstance)) {
1520      return false;
1521    }
1522
1523    return m_handle == ((NetworkTableInstance) other).m_handle;
1524  }
1525
1526  @Override
1527  public int hashCode() {
1528    return m_handle;
1529  }
1530
1531  private boolean m_owned;
1532  private final int m_handle;
1533}
